title: China donates flour to women in the Republic of Congo
description: On March 22, 2013 Chinese Ambassador to the Republic of Congo Guian Jian offered a donation of six mills of fufu (cassava flour) to a group of women in Brazzaville. The donation was received by the Secretary General of the Congo Assistance Foundation (CAF), Michel Mongo.
combined_text:
# Sector
DEVELOPMENTAL FOOD AID/FOOD SECURITY ASSISTANCE

# Title
China donates flour to women in the Republic of Congo

# Description
On March 22, 2013 Chinese Ambassador to the Republic of Congo Guian Jian offered a donation of six mills of fufu (cassava flour) to a group of women in Brazzaville. The donation was received by the Secretary General of the Congo Assistance Foundation (CAF), Michel Mongo.
justification: Project is focused on food aid and social development without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Donation of cassava flour to women's group, developmental food aid focus

title: China donates books to library in the Republic of Congo
description: On May 28, 2013 Chinese Ambassador to the Republic of Congo Guian Jian handed over 1500 literary works to the library at the national Center of Radio and Television (CNRTV) to government spokesman Bienvenu Okiemy in Brazzaville. The books are about diplomacy and Chinese culture.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
China donates books to library in the Republic of Congo

# Description
On May 28, 2013 Chinese Ambassador to the Republic of Congo Guian Jian handed over 1500 literary works to the library at the national Center of Radio and Television (CNRTV) to government spokesman Bienvenu Okiemy in Brazzaville. The books are about diplomacy and Chinese culture.
justification: Project involves donation of books for cultural and educational purposes without direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of 1500 literary works about diplomacy and Chinese culture to a library

title: China Eximbank provides $54.8 million loan for 264 Mpila Social Housing Units Construction Project (Linked to Project ID#60219)
description: On June 19, 2006, China Eximbank and the Republic of Congo signed a $1.6 billion loan framework agreement — also known in the Republic of Congo as the “strategic partnership” (“partenariat stratégique”) — that allowed the Republic of Congo to obtain China Eximbank loans for infrastructure projects through a securitization mechanism: Société Nationales des Pétroles Congolais (SNPC)—the country’s state-owned oil company—agreed to deposit a portion of the cash proceeds from its oil exports into an escrow account that is controlled by China Eximbank. This framework agreement (captured in Project ID#60219) was ratified on October 26, 2006.    One of the subsidiary loans that was approved through the framework agreement was a $54,800,000 loan in 2013 for the 264 Mpila Social Housing Units Construction Project. The loan carried a 13-year maturity and a 0.25% interest rate. Its estimated grace period was 4 years.   The proceeds of the loan were to be used by the borrower to finance 85% of the cost of a $64.47 million commercial contract with Weihai International Economic & Technical Cooperative Co., Ltd (WIETC). The loan’s (principal) amount outstanding was $45,587,625 as of December 31, 2019. WIETC was the contractor responsible for implementation. This project was initiated in August 2013 and completed in August 2016.
staff_comments: 1. The French project title is Construction 264 Logements sociaux. The Chinese project title is 姆皮拉住房项目. 2. The China Eximbank loan that supported this project is not included in the database of Chinese loan commitments that SAIS-CARI released in July 2020. Nor is it included in the the Chinese Overseas Development Finance Dataset published by Boston University’s Global Development Policy Center in December 2020. 3. According to a 2019 report published by the Republic of Congo’s National Assembly, all loans approved under the June 19, 2006 framework agreement had grace periods between 3 and 5 years. Therefore, since the grace period of the China Eximbank loan for the 264 Mpila Social Housing Units Construction Project is missing, AidData imputes a value (4 years) at the middle of the distribution of this range as an approximation. 4. This project is separate from the RMB 310 million China Eximbank loan for the Mpila Social Housing Construction Project (captured via Project ID#68909).
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
China Eximbank provides $54.8 million loan for 264 Mpila Social Housing Units Construction Project (Linked to Project ID#60219)

# Description
On June 19, 2006, China Eximbank and the Republic of Congo signed a $1.6 billion loan framework agreement — also known in the Republic of Congo as the “strategic partnership” (“partenariat stratégique”) — that allowed the Republic of Congo to obtain China Eximbank loans for infrastructure projects through a securitization mechanism: Société Nationales des Pétroles Congolais (SNPC)—the country’s state-owned oil company—agreed to deposit a portion of the cash proceeds from its oil exports into an escrow account that is controlled by China Eximbank. This framework agreement (captured in Project ID#60219) was ratified on October 26, 2006.    One of the subsidiary loans that was approved through the framework agreement was a $54,800,000 loan in 2013 for the 264 Mpila Social Housing Units Construction Project. The loan carried a 13-year maturity and a 0.25% interest rate. Its estimated grace period was 4 years.   The proceeds of the loan were to be used by the borrower to finance 85% of the cost of a $64.47 million commercial contract with Weihai International Economic & Technical Cooperative Co., Ltd (WIETC). The loan’s (principal) amount outstanding was $45,587,625 as of December 31, 2019. WIETC was the contractor responsible for implementation. This project was initiated in August 2013 and completed in August 2016.
justification: Project focuses on social housing construction without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: 264 Mpila Social Housing Units Construction Project, social infrastructure focus

title: China Eximbank provides RMB 400 million government concessional loan for Mpila High School and Middle School Construction Project
description: On March 29, 2013, China Eximbank and the Republic of Congo signed an RMB 400 million government concessional loan (GCL) agreement for the Mpila High School and Middle School Construction Project. This loan reportedly carried the following borrowing terms: 19-year maturity and 5-year grace period.   The purpose of this project was to construction the Revolution Olilou-Gampo school complex, which is located in Ouenzé in the 5th district of Brazzaville. The complex includes two separate administrative blocks for the high school and the middle school. These blocks consist of an amphitheater with 364 seats; a library with an adjoining reading room; a multimedia center; a medical room; meeting rooms; multipurpose rooms; catering areas; 40 offices; three teachers' rooms; toilet blocks; twelve laboratory rooms equipped for languages, physics, chemistry and life and earth sciences; a 3000 seat modern gymnasium, a football field; roads; three electricity generators for the high school, college, and gymnasium; and a water well supplying four water tanks. The complex also includes seven school buildings — three for the high school and four for the middle school. The school complex can accommodate 10,000 students.   Weihai International Economic & Technical Cooperative Co., Ltd (WIETC) was the contractor responsible for implementation. Construction began in 2013. A project completion ceremony took place on October 6, 2017 and the school subsequently ushered in the first batch of students.  There are some indications that the China Eximbank loan for the Mpila High School and Middle School Construction Project may have financially underperformed vis-a-vis the original expectations of the lender. In 2020, China Eximbank and the Republic of Congo signed a debt suspension agreement as part of the G-20 Debt Service Suspension Initiative (DSSI). Under the terms of the agreement, the lender agreed to suspend principal and interest payments due between May 1, 2020 and December 31, 2020 under multiple buyer’s credit loan (BCL) agreements and multiple government concessional loan (GCL) agreements (as captured via Project ID#95566 and ID#95571).  Debt service payments under many of these loan agreements were again deferred in 2021 (as captured via Project ID#95573, 95572, 95570, and 95568). The IMF assessed the Republic of Congo to be in debt distress in 2021, 2022, and 2023.
staff_comments: 1. This project is also known as the Revolution-Gampo-Ollilou Complex Construction Project. The Chinese project title is 姆皮拉中学 or 姆皮拉学校非运会体育馆 or 刚果（布）姆皮拉学校项目. The French project title is Projet de reconstruction et de modernisation de Mpila-Ouenzé or Le complexe Révolution-Gampo-Ollilou or Construction complexe de MPILA or Lycée Moderne de la Révolution.2.  According to the World Bank's Debtor Reporting System (DRS), the weighted average interest rate of all official sector lending from Chinese creditors to government and government-guaranteed borrowing institutions in the Republic of Congo was 1.4846% in 2013. AidData estimates the interest rate of the China Eximbank loan that supported the Mpila High School and Middle School Construction Project by using this figure. See https://www.dropbox.com/s/ab8qt4n6jijcbhd/IDS_Average%20interest%20on%20new%20external%20debt%20commitments.xlsx?dl=0
combined_text:

# Description

title: Chinese Government dispatches 22nd medical team to Sino-Congolese Friendship Hospital and Loandjili General Hospital (Linked to Project ID#30200)
description: Since 1967, the Chinese Government has been dispatching medical teams to the Republic of Congo every two years. Tianjin City is responsible for sending the teams. In 2013, the Chinese Government dispatched the 22nd Chinese medical team to the Republic of Congo [第22批援刚（布）医疗队].   The 33-member team was stationed at Sino-Congolese Friendship Hospital (or Hôpital d'amitié sino-congolaise de M’Filou or l'Hôpital de base de Mfilou) and Loandjili General Hospital (or Hôpital Loandjili or Hôpital Général De Loandjili). The Sino-Congolese Friendship Hospital is located in M’Filou, which is the 7th arrondissement of the capital city of Brazzaville. Loandjili General Hospital is located in the city of in Pointe-Noire. 23 members of the team were stationed at Sino-Congolese Friendship Hospital and 10 members of the team were stationed at Loandjili General Hospital. They completed their term of service between June 6, 2013 and 2015.
staff_comments: The arrival of the 22nd medical team was accompanied by a Chinese Government pledge to equip the Sino-Congolese Friendship Hospital with medical equipment worth RMB 10 million (see Project ID#30200).
combined_text:

Since 1967, the Chinese Government has been dispatching medical teams to the Republic of Congo every two years. Tianjin City is responsible for sending the teams. In 2013, the Chinese Government dispatched the 22nd Chinese medical team to the Republic of Congo [第22批援刚（布）医疗队].   The 33-member team was stationed at Sino-Congolese Friendship Hospital (or Hôpital d'amitié sino-congolaise de M’Filou or l'Hôpital de base de Mfilou) and Loandjili General Hospital (or Hôpital Loandjili or Hôpital Général De Loandjili). The Sino-Congolese Friendship Hospital is located in M’Filou, which is the 7th arrondissement of the capital city of Brazzaville. Loandjili General Hospital is located in the city of in Pointe-Noire. 23 members of the team were stationed at Sino-Congolese Friendship Hospital and 10 members of the team were stationed at Loandjili General Hospital. They completed their term of service between June 6, 2013 and 2015.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare services without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Medical team deployment to hospitals, healthcare sector focus

title: CRBC provides scholarships for 100 students at Chang'an University
description: In September 2013 the China Road & Bridge Corporation announced scholarships to 100 Congolese students for a five-year undergraduate education at Chang'an University in Xi'an, Shaanxi province. The students will be sent in five batches over the next five years, with the first 20 beginning in 2013 and study civil engineering and related fields. There will be 20 students each year for total 5 years.  The total cost of this donation is unclear.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
CRBC provides scholarships for 100 students at Chang'an University

# Description
In September 2013 the China Road & Bridge Corporation announced scholarships to 100 Congolese students for a five-year undergraduate education at Chang'an University in Xi'an, Shaanxi province. The students will be sent in five batches over the next five years, with the first 20 beginning in 2013 and study civil engineering and related fields. There will be 20 students each year for total 5 years.  The total cost of this donation is unclear.
justification: Project focuses on education and human capital development without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Scholarships for 100 students in civil engineering, education-focused initiative

title: Chinese government donates forestry equipment and materials to the Ministry of Forest Economy and Sustainable Development
description: On December 2, 2013, Chinese government donated a batch of forestry equipment and materials to the Ministry of Forest Economy and Sustainable Development of Republic of Congo (中国政府向刚果政府赠送一笔林业物资). The Minister of Forestry Economics and Sustainable Development, Henry Jomb, took over as a representative of the Congo. The materials are mainly composed of forest fire trucks, which will enhance the technical and business capabilities of the “Gang National Greening and Reforestation Program” (material benefit unit). The material includes 1 command vehicle (used to improve the staff's power), 20 fire patrol vehicles (to ensure that they arrive at the fire site in the first place), 100 GPS and 170 generator sets, which will be mainly allocated to The "Congolese National Greening and Reforestation Program". The equipments will be used to improve its operational capabilities and enable it to achieve its goal as soon as possible, namely, 1 million hectares of afforestation within 10 years.
combined_text:
# Sector
AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY, FISHING

# Title
Chinese government donates forestry equipment and materials to the Ministry of Forest Economy and Sustainable Development

# Description
On December 2, 2013, Chinese government donated a batch of forestry equipment and materials to the Ministry of Forest Economy and Sustainable Development of Republic of Congo (中国政府向刚果政府赠送一笔林业物资). The Minister of Forestry Economics and Sustainable Development, Henry Jomb, took over as a representative of the Congo. The materials are mainly composed of forest fire trucks, which will enhance the technical and business capabilities of the “Gang National Greening and Reforestation Program” (material benefit unit). The material includes 1 command vehicle (used to improve the staff's power), 20 fire patrol vehicles (to ensure that they arrive at the fire site in the first place), 100 GPS and 170 generator sets, which will be mainly allocated to The "Congolese National Greening and Reforestation Program". The equipments will be used to improve its operational capabilities and enable it to achieve its goal as soon as possible, namely, 1 million hectares of afforestation within 10 years.
justification: Project focuses on forestry equipment donation for reforestation and fire prevention, without clear energy transition impacts
evidence: Donation of forest fire trucks, GPS units, and generator sets for national greening and reforestation program

title: Chinese government funds 37 Congolese students to study in China in 2013-2014 academic year
description: In 2013, Chinese government funded 37 students of Republic of Congo with scholarship to study in China (刚果（布）37名学子获奖学金赴华留学). The 37 students in this group were previously selected by the Ministry of Higher Education of the Congo (Brazzaville) to qualify for scholarship. They are scheduled to start in early September 2013 and go to 28 universities in 16 cities including Beijing, Shanghai and Dalian to start a five-year school life, involving majors in finance, journalism, medicine, and national relations. Of these students, 28 will participate in undergraduate study, 8 will pursue a master's degree, and one will pursue a doctorate.  On August 29, 2013, Chinese Embassy in Republic of Congo held a reception for these students.  The educational cooperation between China and Congo (Brazzaville) started in 1973. So far, 331 Congolese (Brazzaville) students have won scholarships from the Chinese government to go to China for further study.
combined_text:

evidence: Scholarships for 37 students in various academic fields, part of educational cooperation program
